solution_line_template: First find the final number of knives Carolyn has: {traded_knives} knives + {initial_knives} knives = <<{traded_knives}+{initial_knives}={final_knives}>>{final_knives} knives

Then find the initial number of spoons Carolyn has: {initial_knives} knives * {knives_for_spoons_ratio} spoons/knife = <<{initial_knives}*{knives_for_spoons_ratio}={initial_spoons}>>{initial_spoons} spoons
Then find the final number of spoons Carolyn has: {initial_spoons} spoons - {traded_spoons} spoons = <<{initial_spoons}-{traded_spoons}={final_spoons}>>{final_spoons} spoons

Then find the total final amount of silverware Carolyn has: {final_spoons} spoons + {final_knives} knives + {initial_forks} forks = <<{final_spoons}+{final_knives}+{initial_forks}={total_silverware}>>{total_silverware} pieces

Then divide the number of knives by the total number of pieces and multiply by {percentage_multiplier}% to express the answer as a percentage: {final_knives} knives / {total_silverware} pieces * {percentage_multiplier}% = {percentage_knives}%
